message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CR 

This paper discusses a new approach to peer review in scientific communities, which is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science. The use of simulation studies to investigate the parameters of the approach suggests a focus on data analysis and machine learning (cs.DL). The approach also involves ranking and evaluating proposals, which is relevant to information retrieval (cs.IR) and social networks (cs.SI). The use of a modified Borda count and a new method called Concordance Index-based Global Ranking suggests a focus on algorithms and complexity (cs.CY) and cryptography (cs.CR). Overall, these sub-categories are the most likely to be relevant to the content of this paper.
